channel.title: Making a webclient (PI) help
channel.description: Hello, I have recently started coding a blank PI it still has the old look, anyways, I'm very new to PI and I need help putting my client on my site:/, it's all put together with other clients like auto cache dl's I'm just a little confused with the old source, or a noob you can say, but can someone please help me with it because I want to add customs and have people on, ect. I really want to do this over tv so if I can message you my tv info and you can help thnx ,bluedevil666 :D

item.title: Making a webclient (PI) help
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

IK HOW TO JAR A FILE
but I cant because my files are unorganized and I need someone to help me sort them out![/quote]

Make a new folder and add the sprites FOLDER and the cache CONTENTS into that new folder I had you make. There you go you are done.

Now all you have to do is zip/upload/add link to dler/boom.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a webclient (PI) help
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Ehmm, there’s tutorials on how to make a webclient.
I’ll do a mini tutorial here:

  1. Download JAR maker, Google it and you should find it.
  2. Open it, and set the output directory. The output directory is where the JAR file will be generated (put).
  3. Set the output jar file, make sure the last part ends in .jar (last time, I forgot and set it to .java by mistake and the JAR didn’t work :facepalm:)
  4. Set the input directory. The input directory is where your .class files are located.
  5. Click manifest template, and set the main class as client <<< This part is really important, screw this up and your JAR file won’t load.
  6. Click OK and press Create Jar!

Congratulations, you’ve jarred your client. Look for a webclient tutorial for other bits. Like the HTML code, how to edit the cache, how to sign the JAR.

GL.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a webclient (PI) help
item.dc:creator: @The7thSanctum The7thSanctum
item.description:
@The7thSanctum wrote:

You’ll need to .jar your client, Sign it and get a HTML code to slap onto a website. You’ll also need to configure your signlink.java to work for all operating systems.

Read full topic
